title: Game Page Template
Mafia
text:
Mafia









This is a multi-player social deduction game. Players are given the role of either townsfolk or mafia. The townsfolk want to remove the mafia from town and the mafia to kill atleast half the townsfolk.


 Rules video
 Watch us play
 Read the manual

title: Eleusis Express
text:
Eleusis Express









In this game of inductive reasoning, the clue giver thinks of a rule. Players place cards from their hand trying to experimentally determine the clue-giver’s rule.


 Play the game
 Rules video
 Watch us play
 Read the manual

title: Khatti Mithai
text:
Khatti Mithai









All the squares on the board are filled with white tokens – except the bottom left corner which has a black piece. On a turn pick a token and remove it as well as all tokens above and to the right of it. Player who takes the black token loses the game.


 Play the game
 Rules video
 Watch us play
 Read the manual
 Printable PDF

title: Detectives
text:
Detectives









The alphabet cards are shuffled, one removed and the rest distributed between the players. On a turn pass an opponent a query card to learn how many of those are in their hand. Players compete to deduce which card was removed.


 Play the game
 Rules video
 Watch us play
 Read the manual
 Printable PDF

title: Kachufal
text:
Kachufal









A different number of cards are dealt to players each round. Players decide how many tricks they believe they can win and the trump is set by drawing the top card. The hand size reduces from 10-1 over 10 rounds. Player who wins the most tricks also wins the game.


 Play the game
 Rules video
 Watch us play
 Read the manual

title: Paper Boxing
text:
Paper Boxing









Leaving the top-left corner of the board empty, Lata and Raj secretly enter the numbers from 1 to 15 into their 4 x 4 grid boards. Each round, by connecting to the previous number, they select the number for the bout, comparing it to the other player’s. The higher number wins the bout for a point. Play continues with players extending their lines to an empty neighbour selecting the new number to box. Play continues till all numbers are used or it is no longer possible to play and the player with hihgest score wins.


 Play the game
 Rules video
 Watch us play
 Read the manual
 Printable PDF

title: Jotto
text:
Jotto









Lata thinks of a word and writes blanks for each letter. Raj makes a guess and Lata has to tell him the number of letters common to his word and hers as well as the number that are in the right place. Play continues till the word is revealed.


 Play the game
 Rules video
 Watch us play
 Read the manual

title: Digit Party
text:
Digit Party









Each player has a 5 x 5 grid onto which they place the digit called. A digit forms a link with neighbours that have the same value. Players aim to pack their digits in for the most points once the grid is full.


 Play the game
 Rules video
 Watch us play
 Read the manual
 Printable PDF

title: Dodgem
text:
Dodgem









Lata and Raj race across their finish lines. Cars may not reverse or jump over each other. The player with no moves remaining wins the game.


 Play the game
 Rules video
 Watch us play
 Read the manual
 Printable PDF

title: Fake Artist
text:
Fake Artist









Each player recieves a folded chit of paper with a word. All but one, the fake artist, receives the same word. They take turns drawing a curve on a shared sheet. After each has drawn 2 curves each (including the fake artist) points to another player, accusing them of being the fake. If most point to the fake, he has a chance to guess the word. If correct he wins. Otherwise the artists win. If they get it wrong, the fake wins.


 Rules video
 Watch us play
 Read the manual

title: Monikers
text:
Monikers









A more involved version of charades, this game is played over several rounds. In the first round, players give verbal clues to get their group to guess as many words as possible. In subsequent rounds, with the same word list, players may use only a single word, actions and finally just the movement of one hand. The group that guesses the most words wins the game.


 Rules video
 Watch us play
 Read the manual

title: Ultimate Tic Tac Toe
text:
Ultimate Tic Tac Toe









Lata and Raj play nested tictactoe. Each move decides the board on which the other can play. By winning a board they make their mark on the main board. Players aim to make a line of 3 by winning 3 boards in a row.


 Play the game
 Rules video
 Watch us play
 Read the manual
 Printable PDF

title: Tablut
text:
Tablut









An exciting ancient game of Viking chess, white attempts to get the king to the boundary and black attempts to surround and capture the king.


 Play the game
 Rules video
 Watch us play
 Read the manual
 Printable PDF

title: Regicide
text:
Regicide









Regicide is a co-operative game played with a regukar deck of cards. The King, Queen and Jack cards represent the royalty and are placed on the board. Players are dealt cards from the rest of the deck. They play their hand attempting to bring the royals to their side and win the game.


 Rules video
 Watch us play
 Read the manual
 Printable PDF

title: Dicey Dice
text:
Dicey Dice









Players decide to place bets on up to 3 spaces on the board. 2 dice are rolled and payoffs earned for successful bids. The player with the most money after 10 rounds wins the game.


 Play the game
 Rules video
 Watch us play
 Read the manual
 Printable PDF

title: Watch Your Step
text:
Watch Your Step









Players take turns rolling a dice trying to lead the pack but not fall off the cliff!


 Play the game
 Rules video
 Watch us play
 Read the manual
 Printable PDF

title: 3 Red 1 Black
text:
3 Red 1 Black









Each player gets 4 cards — 3 red and 1 black. Play proceeds around the table with each player placing a card in front of themselves or opening a bid on the number of reds on the table. Any player may raise the bid whoever wins starts revealing cards. First all their cards on the table then, starting from the top, cards in front of any number of opponents. If the revealer finds a black card, they lose a card. If they open all the cards they bid for they receive a point. First to 2 points wins the game.


 Play the game
 Rules video
 Watch us play
 Read the manual

title: LAP
text:
LAP









Battleship’s smarter older sibling! Lata and Raj each decide their tetromino maps. They now try to guess at each other’s layout but probing locations on the map.


 Play the game
 Rules video
 Watch us play
 Read the manual
 Printable PDF

title: Domineering
text:
Domineering









2 players, Lata and Raj, play a game of domino (placing or) shading. The two take turns shading 2 adjacent squares. Raj may only shade horizontally and Lata vertically. Whoever is able to make the last move wins the game.


 Play the game
 Rules video
 Watch us play
 Read the manual
 Printable PDF

title: Tac Tix
text:
Tac Tix









Lata and Raj try to outwit each other. On a turn they pick a row or column and remove any number of tokens that are next to each other. Whoever manages to take tokens last wins the game.


 Play the game
 Rules video
 Watch us play
 Read the manual
 Printable PDF

title: Hex
text:
Hex









Lata and Raj take turns colouring in a hex on the board. Lata tries to connect the sides in her colour. Raj tries to connect the sides in his colour.


 Play the game
 Rules video
 Watch us play
 Read the manual
 Printable PDF

title: Racetrack
text:
Racetrack









A game that models accelarations of a car around a racetrack, players aim to successfully navigate turns without crashing and be the first across the finish line.


 Play the game
 Rules video
 Watch us play
 Read the manual
 Printable PDF

title: Black Box
text:
Black Box









One player decides the location of 5 atoms in a black box. The other shines light into the box and, using the rules of scattering, deduces the position of each atom.


 Play the game
 Rules video
 Watch us play
 Read the manual
 Printable PDF

title: Toads and Frogs
text:
Toads and Frogs









Place 3 black (toad) tokens on the left most spaces and 3 white (frog) tokens on the rightmost spaces of the board. On a turn, a piece can move a single step (toward the centre of the board). They can also jump over an opponent piece into an empty space. The player who is able to make the last move wins the game.


 Play the game
 Rules video
 Watch us play
 Read the manual
 Printable PDF

title: No Thanks
text:
No Thanks









Reveal a card. Either take it or place a token and pass it along. Cards give points and tokens reduce them. The player with the least points wins!


 Play the game
 Rules video
 Watch us play
 Read the manual
 Printable PDF

title: Goats and Tigers
text:
Goats and Tigers









3 tigers start on the board. Every round a goat is added, then a tiger moved. If able, a tiger can jump over a goat to capture it. Once all 15 goats are placed, they too move on their turn.The goats win if the tigers cannot move. Tigers win if they capture 5 goats.


 Play the game
 Rules video
 Watch us play
 Read the manual
 Printable PDF

title: Home
text:
Welcome to Games at CCL!
This is a selection of games curated at the Centre for Creative Learning, IIT Gandhinagar. These games can be recreated with easily accesible material and you will find rules, videos and boards to play them here. :-)






About These Games
This collection of games has been curated for a variety of situations to meet several curricular goals. You will find resources for this (where relevant) on the game pages. Here is a PDF for all of the games manuals.
In order to play them you will often need pen, paper, dice and tokens in two colours. Buttons of size 20mm work well. Some games have custom cards or game boards – black and white versions can be downloaded here.




Types of Games
Most games displayed here have simple rules. They are split into games that can be used in the Mathematics and Science classrooms. Some are also good for Language or Social and Emotional Learning (SEL). To indicate game type, the manual and page background are colour coded.


  
    
  
  
    
  
  
    
  
  
    
  





Complexity
We enjoy playing even the simplest of these so a low complexity game is not just for primary school. However here is a rough correlation between age and complexity.



  
    
      
    
    Simple rules.
    Class 3 (8 years) +
  

  
    
      
      
    
    Somewhat complicated rules or strategy.
    Class 6 (11 years) +
  

  
    
      
      
      
    
    More challenging rules or strategy.
    Class 9 (14 years) +
  





Player Counts
We have games for different numbers of players. ‘Solo’ indicates games for one player (solo play), ‘2 players’ are typically strategy games that support exactly two players, ‘Between 3 and 10’ is for games that can be played with more than two but less than 10, and ‘10 and more’ are for very large groups - get the whole class to play!







Find a game to play
What kind of game are you looking for? Let us pick one for you or answer these questions for a more customized selection!


  
  
    How much time do you have?
    
      Any
      ≤ 10 mins
      10–20 mins
      20–30 mins
      30–40 mins
    
  

  
    How many players?
    
      Any
      Solo
      2 Players
      Between 3 and 10
      10 and more
    
  

  
    What difficulty?
    
      Any
      Easy
      Medium
      Hard
    
  

  
    SUBMIT
  




  


  Pick randomly from these







  
    
  

  

    
      
        
      
    

    
    

    
      Indian Institute of Technology, Gandhinagar, Gujarat - 382355
      Contact: 079-23952240 | gamesweplay.ccl@gmail.com
      © 2025 Center for Creative Learning | IIT Gandhinagar

And of course, thank you to everyone who played, shared, and improved our games with their joyful curiosity.

 


“Alone we can do so little; together we can do so much.”
— Helen Keller



“If you cannot solve a problem, there is an easier problem you cannot solve. Find that problem”
— Pólya

title: Char Par
text:
Char Par









Lata and Raj each have 9 tokens in their colour that they take turns placing to the board, attempting to make a line of 3. Once a line is formed, an opponent piece is removed. Once all tokens are placed, tokens can be moved.


 Play the game
 Rules video
 Watch us play
 Read the manual
 Printable PDF

title: Farkle Frenzy
text:
Farkle Frenzy









A turn starts with 6 dice to roll. Set aside any number of dice, incrementing your score. Roll the remaining dice and again set aside any dice you want to long as score increases. If no die increments score, the turn ends at once with 0 points scored. If all 6 dice score, write your score down and take another turn! First to 10k wins the game.


 Play the game
 Rules video
 Watch us play
 Read the manual
 Printable PDF

title: Battle Ship
text:
Battle Ship









Players mark their battle ships on their hidden grid. Calling out grid locations they try to bomb and sink their opponents’ ships.


 Play the game
 Rules video
 Watch us play
 Read the manual
 Printable PDF

title: Order and Chaos
text:
Order and Chaos









2 players — Order and Chaos — play a game of TicTacToe. They take turns placing a mark on the board. Either can play either a O or an X on their turn. Order wants to create a line of 5. Chaos wants to prevent it. Who will succeed?


 Play the game
 Rules video
 Watch us play
 Read the manual
 Printable PDF

title: Sprouts
text:
Sprouts









Play starts with 3 dots on an empty page. Lata and Raj take turns joinining any two dots and placing a new dot on this new line. Previous lines may not be crossed and once a dot has 3 lines coming out of it, it can no longer be used. Player who is able to make the last line wins.


 Play the game
 Rules video
 Watch us play
 Read the manual

title: Liar’s Dice
text:
Liar’s Dice









Players shake their dice in a cup and keep them covered on the table. After secretly looking at their own dice they bid on the rolls of the whole table. Succesful bids give points but unsuccesful ones result in the loss of dice!


 Play the game
 Rules video
 Watch us play
 Read the manual

title: Saesara
text:
Saesara









A game of inductive reasoning, in Saesara players aim to unravel the clue giver’s secret rule.


 Play the game
 Rules video
 Watch us play
 Read the manual
 Printable PDF

title: Aces and Faces
text:
Aces and Faces









This game is played with only the Aces, Jacks, Queens and Kings from a deck of cards. Each cards has four characteristics (colour, gender, suit type and royalty). Lata and Raj give each other a card to place each round. The first to make a line of four with shared characteristic wins.


 Play the game
 Rules video
 Watch us play
 Read the manual

title: Neighbours
text:
Neighbours









This is a game that an entire class can play. Each player gets a board (grid) and a pen. Both dice are rolled and the values added. Each player writes this number on their board. Once the grid is filled, both row and column scores are calculated. Score is based on the number of times a digit is placed adjacent to itself. Maximum score wins.


 Play the game
 Rules video
 Watch us play
 Read the manual
 Printable PDF

title: Sequencium
text:
Sequencium









Lata and Raj take turns writing their next highest number to an empty adjacent square on the board. The player who places the highest number wins the game.


 Play the game
 Rules video
 Watch us play
 Read the manual
 Printable PDF

title: Two Rooms and a Boom
text:
Two Rooms and a Boom









Each player recieves a card that indicates their team and character. The blue team has the president and the red team a bomber. Players are split into 2 groups. Members of the red team aim to get president and bomber in the same room while members of the blue team aim to prevent this.


 Rules video
 Watch us play
 Read the manual
 Printable PDF

title: Star Nim
text:
Star Nim









Lata and Raj take turns removing tokens from the board. On a turn they can always remove one token. They could remove two, if the tokens are connected by a line. The one who removes the last token wins the game.


 Play the game
 Rules video
 Watch us play
 Read the manual
 Printable PDF

title: Blockade
text:
Blockade









Lata and Raj may either move their pawn forward a step or place a wall to block their opponent’s progress. The first player to reach the other side wins the game.


 Play the game
 Rules video
 Watch us play
 Read the manual
 Printable PDF

title: 13 Sheep
text:
13 Sheep









A die is rolled each round. Players draw the fence corresponding to the outcome somewhere on their individual boards. Fences may not overlap, intersect or pass through bushes. The player who protects the most sheep at the end of the game wins.


 Play the game
 Rules video
 Watch us play
 Read the manual
 Printable PDF

title: Hold that Line
text:
Hold that Line









Lata draws a line connecting 2 dots on a 4 x 4 grid. Raj can now extend one end of the line, connecting to another dot. Play continues and the last one to extend the line loses!


 Play the game
 Rules video
 Watch us play
 Read the manual
 Printable PDF

title: Amazons
text:
Amazons









Start by placing tokens of two colours in the indicated space. These are your warrior queens, Amazons, and each moves like a chess queen (as far as they like in any direction). On a turn a piece must move and then shoot a flaming arrow. The arrow can land as far as you like, in any direction from the piece. Cross off the square where the Arrow lands. No piece or arrow can cross a burnt position. The last player able to take a turn (move and shoot) wins the game.


 Play the game
 Rules video
 Watch us play
 Read the manual
 Printable PDF

title: Konane
text:
Konane









An old Hawaiian checkers game. Konane starts with tokens on all spaces. Players remove 2 tokens to begin the game which proceeds with a player removing an opponent’s piece from the board by jumping their piece over it. The player unable to move loses the game.


 Play the game
 Rules video
 Watch us play
 Read the manual
 Printable PDF

title: Criss Cross
text:
Criss Cross









2 dice are rolled and each player enters both numbers to adjacent (like a domino) spaces of their board. Players aim to maximise their score by placing digits next to themselves.


 Play the game
 Rules video
 Watch us play
 Read the manual
 Printable PDF

title: Corners
text:
Corners









Lata and Raj take turns shading and making circles of their colour on the board. At the beginning of a turn, if they notice a square formed by circles of their colour they shade them. A shaded corner can be part of a new square later and unshaded corners are now shaded. Once the board is full, each player scores 3 points per shaded corner. The player with the most points wins the game.


 Play the game
 Rules video
 Watch us play
 Read the manual
 Printable PDF

title: Peg Solitaire
text:
Peg Solitaire









This single-player game starts with pieces on all but one space on the board. Jumping a piece over another removes it from the board. The aim is to get to a single token.


 Play the game
 Rules video
 Watch us play
 Read the manual
 Printable PDF

title: The Great Races
text:
The Great Races









Each player participates in 11 races. On a turn roll 4 dice and pair them up, adding their outcomes. Move on the races corresponding to these numbers. Once 8 races are completed, players score for being first or secnd in a race. The twist is that the player to reach a finish spot laater takes the award!


 Play the game
 Rules video
 Watch us play
 Read the manual
 Printable PDF

title: Eat Poop You Cat
text:
Eat Poop You Cat









Players sit in a circle, each with a pen and paper. Each one writes a sentence and then passes their sheet to the left. On the paper they received, they draw a figure for the sentence, fold so only their figure is seen and again pass the paper. Players now see only a figure for which they write a caption, fold to cover everything from before and pass again. Play continues until each receives their original sheet. At this point they can open it to see how their sentence has changed!


 Rules video
 Watch us play
 Read the manual

title: Lines of Action
text:
Lines of Action









Lata and Raj place their pieces on opposite edges of the board. A piece moves in a line a number of steps equal to the number of pieces in that line, into an empty space or removing an opponent. The first to get all their pieces in a single cluster wins the game.


 Play the game
 Rules video
 Watch us play
 Read the manual
 Printable PDF

title: Don’t Say 13
text:
Don’t Say 13









Lata and Raj play a number game. Lata starts and can say either 1 or 2. Raj can add 1 or 2 to her number. They take turns until one of them is forced to say 13, losing the game.


 Play the game
 Rules video
 Watch us play
 Read the manual

title: The Flower and the Wind
text:
The Flower and the Wind









The flower gets to place a mark each round. The wind selects a direction and adds seeds (in that direction) behind each flower. If every position is filled, the flower wins. If even one remains unfilled, the wind wins.


 Play the game
 Rules video
 Watch us play
 Read the manual
 Printable PDF

title: Bowling Solitaire
text:
Bowling Solitaire









Two suits of playing cards represent bowling pins and balls. A single player game, we use some number theory to hit as many of the pins as possible each round.


 Play the game
 Rules video
 Watch us play
 Read the manual

title: Qwinto
text:
Qwinto









On a turn, a player decides which dice to roll. They can choose to roll one, two or all three but must write the combined total to one of the matching tracks on their board. Other players may also choose to use the roll. Players try to best utilise the rolls for maximum score.


 Play the game
 Rules video
 Watch us play
 Read the manual
 Printable PDF
